pullRequest.body:
Add two lemmas about the element `X` as term of the normalization monoid $k[[X]]$ for a field `k`.

Co-authored-by: María Inés de Frutos-Fernández @mariainesdff

nodes.body: :v: faenuccio can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9174094576/job/25224204812)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9174094576/job/25224203565)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9174094576/job/25224204136)
you can probably do a single `simp only [normUnit,…]` ; otherwise, delete the semicolon.
otherwise, it looks good to me.

```suggestion
theorem normUnit_X : normUnit (X : PowerSeries k) = 1 := by
  simp [normUnit, ← Units.val_eq_one, Unit_of_divided_by_X_pow_order_nonzero]
```
Also, it can be `simp`.

```suggestion
theorem X_eq_normalizeX : (X : PowerSeries k) = normalize X := by
  simp only [normalize_apply, normUnit_X, Units.val_one, mul_one]
```
If you swap the equality this also can be `simp`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/PowerSeries/Inverse): add two lemmas on the normalization of `(X  : PowerSeries k)`
